title.narrative: PELUM- Seeds & Land models for R2F in UG

description.narrative: Participatory Ecological Land Use Management # PELUM Uganda which is a network of organizations formed in 1995 to promote proper land use and management through capacity building, research and advocacy is contracted as a partner in the R2F project to lead the project consortium in both the project#s seed and land component work. PELUM Uganda with her experience in Community Managed Seeds Security Model (CMSS- model) and her new Climate Resilience Agro Ecosystem (CRAEM), which is a model with a nexus between seeds and land, was chosen as a thematic lead in both seeds and land work. PELUM#s work will also be to build capacity of other consortium membersin both seeds and land, map and establish strategic collaborations with other actors including research organizations at different levels, ensure that partners implementing these models properly document the learning, challenges and practices. Particularly and ofinterest are climate resilience practices under CRAEM model in which PELUM Uganda will provide overall guidance in building partners# and small scale food producers capacity to adopt to climate change related challenges. PELUM Uganda will also conduct indigenous food fair at national and regional levels to promote farmers# seeds sovereignty and conserve <(>&<)> promote, garner support and advocate for traditional seeds. She will also give hands on <(>&<)> technical and financial support to her member organizations implementing Right to Food project through regular monitoring and interface with smallholder food producers (especially women). PELUM will work in Gulu/Omoro, Soroti, Nebbi/Zombo for the seeds component work with her member organizations i.e. International Institute of Rural Reconstructions- IIRR, Community Integrated Development Initiative- CIDI and CEFORD. PELUM will also contract Landnet and Uganda National Farmers Federation- UNFFE as strategic partners on key thematic areas, for instance UNFFE will be contracted on areas like Farmers Advocacy Consultation Tool methodology among others while Landnet will be contracted on land related works, strategic collaborations will also be made with other partners working on seeds and land.

participating-org.narrative: Founded in 1995 by civil society organisations in east central and southern Africa to facilitate networking and learning on ecological land use management among civil society organizations in the region. After its launch in 1995, PELUM Uganda was hostedby member organizations including Environmental Alert, Integrated Rural Development Initiatives and Community Development Resource Network, with a staff from the host institution allocated the responsibility to coordinate PELUM (50% of their staff time) but personnel costs fully paid by the host. PELUM also took advantage of the legal status of the host, also used policies and financial systems of the host In 2006, PELUM registered with the NGO Board and also with the registrar of companies in 2007. In the same year (2006), PELUM employed a full time staff and acquired office space (mid Sept 2006). The coordinator was mainly supported by volunteers (2006 – 2007). Policies we developed and approved by the board in the 1st half of 2007. Audits are done every calendar year. Currently has 3 fulltime staff and 2 volunteers, membership, programs and funding partners are steadily increasing. PELUM has conducted gender workshops for members, has considers gender in its M<(>&<)>E work as well as its HR policy

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
